ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course has taught me a lot about the Deaf/ASL community, and how to communicate using ASL.

I'm so happy about how much I learned in ASL I! Not only did we learn vocab (lots of signs) but we also learned about Deaf culture, literature, art, storytelling, etc. Classes were extremely engaging and I always felt like I took a lot away from the practice we did.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course does a great job at using different teaching activities/skills to help us learn.

I absolutely loved this course -- my professor was fantastic, and although we got through a lot of content, it never felt overwhelming. Since it is a relatively new course (and also with the added challenge of Covid), I think some project guidelines were shifting as the semester progressed and so the longer-term work we were assigned sometimes felt a bit unclear. However, I also liked the open-ended nature of the work we did.

Strengths: great teachers, fun and engaging, I learned SO much
Weaknesses: at times disorganized, sometimes other students took advantage of kindness/flexibility of teachers and did not keep up with class making it hard to engage with each other in class

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, for anyone who is interested in learning ASL and gaining knowledge about the Deaf community, this is the perfect course.
I would absolutely recommend this course -- it's interesting and engaging, and the classroom environment is wonderful and supportive. I learned a lot and am definitely continuing with ASL at Yale.
Yes! I learned so much about Deaf culture and ASL. Class flies by because it is so engaging.
